section.name: Registry Protocol
section.p: The registry protocol handler provides support accessing a remote object published within an RMI registry using a URI in the form registry[:<host>[:<port>]]:<path>.

subsection.name: Specification
subsection.p: The specification of the registry protocol is as follows;

tr.td: The name under which the object is published.

subsection.name: Using an registry URL
subsection.p: Using registry URLs are no different from any http or ftp URLs. You create them by instantiating the java.net.URL class, and setting the protocol to "registry" (no quotes).
The following example registry URI identifies a object named "dpml/station".
The following code demonstrates the resolution of the object.
subsection.source: URI uri = new URI( "registry:dpml/station" ); Station station = (Station) uri.toURL().getContent( new Class[]{Station.class} );
